title: Corazon Aquino
summary: Maria Corazon "Cory" Sumulong Cojuangco Aquino[2] (Tagalog pronunciation: [koɾaˈson aˈkino], 25 January 1933 – 1 August 2009) was a Filipina politician who served as the 11th president of the Philippines from 1986 to 1992. She was the most prominent figure of the 1986 People Power Revolution, which ended the two-decade rule of President Ferdinand Marcos and led to the establishment of the current democratic Fifth Philippine Republic.
